title: 113_hr5593
content:
The "Security Clearance Enhancement Act of 2014" is also known as the Security Clearance Enhancement Act. It aims to improve security clearance investigation procedures. The Security Clearance Enhancement Act of 2014 aims to improve security clearance investigation procedures by amending the collection of data for personnel security investigations, including data from various sources like government, commercial data, consumer reporting agencies, and social media. The Security Clearance Enhancement Act of 2014 aims to enhance security clearance investigations by collecting financial information, credit reports, and associations that may suggest potential risks from individuals. The Security Clearance Enhancement Act of 2014 aims to enhance security clearance investigations by considering various factors such as financial information, credit reports, associations, public information, social media posts, and data from terrorist or criminal watch lists. The Security Clearance Enhancement Act of 2014 requires the maintenance of lists by the Office of Foreign Assets Control, the FBI, and Interpol. It also mandates periodic reinvestigations for accuracy and notification of relevant information to agencies. The Security Clearance Enhancement Act of 2014 mandates periodic reinvestigations for accuracy and notification of relevant information to agencies. Amendments include increasing the frequency of reinvestigations and requiring reports on the effectiveness of databases. Funding is also addressed from the Revolving Fund of the Office of Personnel Management. Management.--Section 1304(e)(1) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include the security clearance system required under the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004. SEC. 3. LIMITATION.

Amendments in this Act do not require increased consideration of minor financial or mental health issues when evaluating access to classified information.

SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE.

Amendments in this Act will take effect 1 year after enactment.
